description: Route a cross-cutting design request to the correct specialist skill
input: I want to add a new shield mechanic that blocks incoming damage and has a durability system. Where should I start?
expected_behavior: Identifies systems-designer as primary, game-balancer as supporting. Suggests checking economy-designer for durability repair costs and ux-designer for shield UI indicator. Provides context from existing GDD combat section.
rubric: Correctly identifies primary skill (systems-designer)
Identifies at least 2 supporting skills
Suggests an order of operations
References relevant GDD sections

input: The combat section says bosses drop 500 Starlight Crystals, but I can't find that currency defined anywhere. Can you check?
expected_behavior: Identifies the missing currency definition as a consistency violation (rule ME-01). Suggests adding the currency to the economy section with source, sink, and exchange rate. Flags the issue for economy-designer.
rubric: Identifies the consistency violation
References the correct cross-reference rule
Suggests concrete fix
Routes to appropriate skill for resolution

description: Suggest daily work priorities based on project state
input: What should I work on today?
expected_behavior: Checks project board status, identifies incomplete GDD sections, considers dependencies, and suggests the highest-priority task with context. Explains why this task is the most impactful.
rubric: Considers sprint goals or project board state
Identifies dependencies and blockers
Suggests a specific, actionable task
Provides context for why this is the priority

description: Parse and index a GDD directory structure
input: I just reorganized my GDD folder. Can you rescan and tell me what sections are present and which are missing?
expected_behavior: Runs parse_gdd.py or manually scans the directory. Maps files to the 12-section taxonomy. Reports which sections are present, which are missing, and their completeness status.
rubric: Uses the GDD section taxonomy correctly
Identifies present and missing sections
Reports section status (draft, complete, missing)
Suggests next steps for gaps

description: Produce a full structured handoff document when routing a design request to a specialist skill
input: I want to add a crew morale system where crew members can become demoralized during long voyages, affecting their skill check performance. Morale should recover at space stations and through narrative events. Please hand this off to the right specialist.
expected_behavior: Produces a structured handoff in the standard format (Design Request title, Discipline, Supporting skills, Context from GDD, Constraints, Open Questions). Identifies systems-designer as primary. Lists narrative-designer and game-balancer as supporting. Pulls context from the Mechanics & Systems section (crew skill checks) and Narrative & Worldbuilding section (crew personal arcs). Notes constraints from the core gameplay loop session target. Poses open questions about morale thresholds, recovery rates, and interaction with existing crew leveling XP.
rubric: Output follows the structured handoff template (title, discipline, supporting, context, constraints, open questions)
Correctly identifies systems-designer as primary and narrative-designer plus game-balancer as supporting
Extracts specific context from at least two existing GDD sections
Lists concrete constraints from existing design decisions
Poses at least 3 actionable open questions for the specialist to resolve

description: Route a request that touches 4 or more disciplines and provide a sequenced order of operations
input: I want to add a new endgame zone called The Shattered Nexus. It needs unique enemies with new combat abilities, a questline revealing the Synthex Collective's origin, rare crafting materials that feed into a new ship upgrade tier, and a dedicated UI for a zone-wide threat meter. How should we tackle this?
expected_behavior: Identifies all relevant disciplines: level-designer (primary, zone layout and encounters), systems-designer (new combat abilities and ship upgrade tier), narrative-designer (Synthex origin questline), economy-designer (rare crafting materials and upgrade costs), ux-designer (threat meter UI), and game-balancer (endgame tuning). Proposes a sequenced order: (1) narrative-designer defines the questline beats and Synthex lore, (2) level-designer builds the zone structure and encounter flow, (3) systems-designer designs the new abilities and upgrade tier, (4) economy-designer sets material drop rates and upgrade costs, (5) ux-designer creates threat meter wireframes, (6) game-balancer tunes difficulty and reward curves. Explains dependencies between each step.
rubric: Identifies at least 4 distinct specialist skills needed
Designates a clear primary skill with rationale
Proposes a numbered order of operations with at least 5 steps
Explains dependency reasoning between steps
References relevant existing GDD sections that each specialist should consult

description: Route an economy-focused request distinguishing primary vs support roles for economy-designer and game-balancer
input: Players in the Frozen Expanse are earning Nova Credits 3x faster than in other regions because ice crystal salvage sells for too much. Meanwhile the Faction Token earn rate for the Drift Clans feels too slow compared to the Terran Accord. Can you figure out who should handle what?
expected_behavior: Identifies two distinct issues. For the Nova Credits inflation: economy-designer is primary (currency source/sink rebalancing for ice crystal pricing), game-balancer is supporting (verifying the fix against the overall earning curve across all regions). For the Faction Token disparity: economy-designer is primary (faction reward structure), narrative-designer is supporting (Drift Clan quest availability may affect token earn rate), game-balancer is supporting (cross-faction parity verification). Provides context from the Economy & Progression section and Level/Content Design section. Distinguishes that economy-designer owns the parameter changes while game-balancer validates them through simulation.
rubric: Separates the input into two distinct issues with independent routing
Correctly assigns economy-designer as primary for both currency concerns
Distinguishes game-balancer's supporting/validation role from economy-designer's ownership role
Identifies narrative-designer as a relevant support for the Faction Token issue
References specific GDD sections for context

description: Generate a completeness report across the full 12-section GDD taxonomy using the section index
input: Using the GDD index at evals/files/gdd-index-partial.json, give me a full completeness report. I need to know exactly where we stand and what the critical gaps are before our milestone review.
expected_behavior: Loads the partial GDD index (7 present sections, 5 missing). Maps all entries against the 12-section taxonomy. Produces a structured report: (1) Summary line (7/12 sections present, 58% coverage). (2) Per-section status table showing all 12 sections with status. (3) Critical gaps analysis identifying Narrative & Worldbuilding and UI/UX Design as the highest-priority missing sections because they block other work. (4) Staleness flags for sections not updated in 30+ days. (5) Recommended action plan prioritized by dependency impact.
rubric: Correctly counts 7 present and 5 missing sections against the 12-section taxonomy
Produces a per-section status table covering all 12 categories
Identifies Narrative & Worldbuilding and UI/UX Design as high-priority gaps with dependency reasoning
Flags stale sections based on last_modified dates
Provides a prioritized action plan ordered by dependency impact
